body: Can confirm the same under X11 and XMonad: window starts as specified by WM and immediately rescales to some fixed size. Pretty annoying, since I launch some terminal apps in fixed-size scratchpads.

To elaborate: was playing now with launching the terminal, the behaviour is not deterministic. To my estimate, there is a chance slightly higher than 50% that Alacritty will respect WM setting and slightly lower than 50% that it will rescale.
Could someone provide an `alacritty -v` output? I use i3 and everything works beautifully there. I suspect that the WM might be resizing and Alacritty resizes itself shortly after that.

```
Created log file at "/tmp/Alacritty-22310.log"
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty.
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Configuration loaded from /home/grayjack/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] device_pixel_ratio: 1.5
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] width: 1536, height: 1152
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Initializing glyph cache
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Finished initializing glyph cache in 0.060801778
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] width: 1536, height: 1152
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Cell Size: (8 x 16)
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Padding: (3 x 3)
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] PTY Dimensions: Line(71) x Column(191)
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Initialisation complete
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] Font size changed: Size(14) [DPR: 1.5]
[2018-11-24 11:25] [INFO] width: 1536, height: 1152
```
Plus, for me, in awesome, it's very deterministic, 100% of the time it is the wrong size

issue.title: Window dimensions changed automatically in i3wm when set to floating
issue.body:
OS : Arch Linux  
WM : i3wm  
Version : alacritty 0.2.3  
Im using X11 with i3.  

[gif showing the error](https://i.imgur.com/x5Ml19v.gifv)

so in i3wm we can toggle windows between tiling and floating state. In terminal emulators like "st", on toggling to floating the dimensions that will be set are the user defined dimensions from the local config file.  

But in case of alacritty, i tried setting dimensions from ~/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml, but there seems to be no use. like on the first spawn of the windows as a tiling window the right dimensions are produced. but after toggling it to tiling window and back to floating automatically, a "logical resize" of the  window is done by alacritty.  

it's not a fault of my i3 config, since i tested it with bare bones config too. and also other terminals like st fine by drawing the right dimensions and also centers the spawned terminal to center of the screen.  

is this a bug? or am i doing something wrong here?  

attaching along the log file and necessary details:  
[alacritty config](https://pastebin.com/VcNDUJWh)
[alacritty print events file](https://pastebin.com/sG02P1FE)
[xprop of automatically dimension changed window](https://pastebin.com/g6Gyt7A4)
[.Xresources](https://pastebin.com/GxNjypQb)
[i3 config](https://pastebin.com/hcTt6vEA)

body:
I'm also using awesome and seeing the same behavior, however here it resizes to 1024 x 768 after awesome had already set it to 800 x 700 (it should be centered on screen so the resizing is evident).
```
Created log file at "/tmp/Alacritty-30021.log"
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty.
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Configuration loaded from /home/neo/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] device_pixel_ratio: 1
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] width: 1024, height: 768
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Initializing glyph cache
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Finished initializing glyph cache in 0.037495531
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] width: 1024, height: 768
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Cell Size: (6 x 14)
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Padding: (2 x 2)
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] PTY Dimensions: Line(54) x Column(170)
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Initialisation complete
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] Font size changed: Size(20) [DPR: 1]
[2019-01-18 11:17] [INFO] width: 1024, height: 768
```
Dimensions are 0 0 in config. Version is 0.2.3 on Arch linux.

@GrayJack I'm using this as a hacky fix in awesome, maybe you find it useful
```lua
local resize_alacritty
client.connect_signal("manage", function(c)
    if not awesome.startup and awful.rules.match(c, { class = "Alacritty" }) then
        client.connect_signal("request::geometry", resize_alacritty)
    end
end)
function resize_alacritty(c)
    c.width, c.height = 800, 700
    client.disconnect_signal("request::geometry", resize_alacritty)
end
```
EDIT: It's a little less hacky now.

Reimplemented it more properly as a normal rule for the `awful.rules.rules` table.
```lua
awful.rules.rules = {
    ...
    { rule = { class = "Alacritty" },
      callback = function(c)
          local resize_alacritty
          function resize_alacritty(_c)
              _c:disconnect_signal("request::geometry", resize_alacritty)
              gears.timer.delayed_call(function()
                  _c.width, _c.height = 800, 700
              end)
          end
          if not awesome.startup then
              c:connect_signal("request::geometry", resize_alacritty)
          end
      end
    },
    ...
```

issue.title: Terminal window not taking all available space
issue.body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on?
KDE Neon
If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland?
X11
KDE Neon comes with Kwin and window manager in which I use [this extension](https://github.com/lingtjien/Grid-Tiling-Kwin) for tiling every other application works fine but not alacritty it just don't follow the tiling 
[Image for reference](https://i.imgur.com/BXV66gS.png)

body:
@Tanuj69 Various people have various preferences as to what needs to be focused on in Alacritty, so the best way to accelerate the progress on one specific issue is to help out with it.

Mentoring is always an option, so if you feel like the Alacritty contributors aren't prioritizing the right things, that's the best choice to fix it.

issue.title: Fix duplicate resize events
issue.body:
If a resize event is identical to the current size, it is no longer
propagated but the resize is discarded immediately.

Fixes #1825.
Fixes #204.

body: Can someone test https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/pull/2307 to see if that helps with things?
